title: cata-list
description: Useful lists of some of the best info, media, tools, and quotes for those who seek to understand and improve this world.

articles.title: SpaceX Sets New Record for Most Satellites on a Single Launch With Latest Falcon 9 Mission
articles.description: SpaceX has set a new all-time record for the most satellites launched and deployed on a single mission, with its Transporter-1 flight on Sunday. The launch was the first of SpaceX's dedicated rideshare missions, in which it splits up the payload capacity of its rocket among multiple customers…

articles.title: Electric Vehicles Close to 'Tipping Point' of Mass Adoption

articles.title: Intelligence Analysts Use U.S. Smartphone Location Data Without Warrants, Memo Says
articles.description: The disclosure comes amid growing legislative scrutiny of how the government uses commercially available location records.

articles.title: The Moronic Firing of Will Wilkinson Illustrates Why Fear and Bad Faith Mob Demands Reign Supreme
articles.description: In the prevailing climate, the rational choice is to avoid social scorn and ostracization no matter how baseless the grievances one must appease.

articles.title: The Echo Chamber Era

articles.title: Vertical Farms Grow Veggies on Site at Restaurants and Grocery Stores
articles.description: Last month we reported that a huge vertical farming operation near Copenhagen in Denmark recently completed its first harvest. That setup uses hydroponics, but the veggies grown in Vertical Field urban farming pods take root in real soil.

articles.title: Palantir's God's-Eye View of Afghanistan
articles.description: The company's software can sift through enormous amounts of data, and those metrics can be used to make life-or-death decisions.

articles.title: Social Media Bans Are Really, Actually, Shockingly Common
articles.description: Booting Trump didn't set a precedent. From Yelp to Uber to Airbnb, platforms regularly ban users and content, but too often behind the scenes.

articles.title: Could Lab-Grown Plant Tissue Ease the Environmental Toll of Logging and Agriculture?
articles.description: MIT researchers have proposed a method for growing plant-based materials, like wood and fiber, in a lab. The technology is still in early development but might one day help reduce the environmental footprint of some types of agriculture.

articles.title: The Ongoing Collapse of the World's Aquifers
articles.description: When humans over-exploit underground water supplies, the ground collapses like a huge empty water bottle. It's called subsidence, and it could affect 1.6 billion people by 2040.

articles.title: A New SolarWinds Malware Strain Is Discovered

articles.title: The New Domestic War on Terror Is Coming
articles.description: No speculation is needed. Those who wield power are demanding it. The only question is how much opposition they will encounter.

articles.title: Behind a Secret Deal Between Google and Facebook
articles.description: Facebook was going to compete with Google for some advertising sales but backed away from the plan after the companies cut a preferential deal, according to court documents.
